flawed_nl_solution:
If Abel needs to travel 1000 miles going 50 miles per hour, this means it will take him 1000/50=<<1000/50=20>>20 hours to get there.
If Alice needs to travel 1000 miles going 40 miles per hour, this means it will take her 1000/40=<<1000/40=25>>25 hours to get there.
Since there are 60 minutes in an hour, this means it will take Abel 20*60= <<20*60=1200>>1200 minutes to arrive.
Similarly, this means it will take Alice 25*60= <<25*60=5100>>5100 minutes to arrive.
This means Abel arrives 5100-1200= <<5100-1200=3900>>3900 minutes before Alice if they both leave simultaneously.
However, since Abel had a head start of 1 hour, which is 60 minutes, this means Abel arrives 3900 + 60 = <<3900+60=3960>>3960 minutes ahead of Alice
#### 3960

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1500, not 5100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
